methods.label: add
methods.comment: Adds an element to the container
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code will print &quot;Error adding&quot; for the first Try/Catch. But for the second, the error will be suppressed and the call to .add() will return False
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim position as Long
Try
    position = coll.add(2)
    Print position &apos; Code will not get to this line
Catch
    Print &quot;Error adding&quot;   &apos; This will be printed
End Try
  
position = coll.add(&quot;2&quot;)
Print position &apos; Code will print 0
methods.signature: Public Function add(source As Variant) As Long
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Adds an element to the container</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Adds an element to the container
methods.inlinecomment: ' Adds an element to the container
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM<br />The following code will print &quot;Error adding&quot; for the first Try/Catch. But for the second, the error will be suppressed and the call to .add() will return False<br />%END REM<br />Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)<br />Dim position as Long<br />Try<br />    position = coll.add(2)<br />    Print position &apos; Code will not get to this line<br />Catch<br />    Print &quot;Error adding&quot;   &apos; This will be printed<br />End Try<br />  <br />position = coll.add(&quot;2&quot;)<br />Print position &apos; Code will print 0

methods.label: addAll
methods.comment: Adds all elements from an array or source Collection to the current Collection.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code creates a collection of scalars containing &quot;One&quot; and 2. It sets suppressErrors on the second collection, then adds the first collection to the second. This adds any strings to the second collection (i.e. &quot;One&quot;), while suppressing errors from any non-String entries (i.e. 2). The second collection contains one element, the string &quot;One&quot;.
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;SCALAR&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim coll2 as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(2)
coll2.suppressErrors = True
Call coll2.addAll(coll)
methods.signature: Public Function addAll(source As Variant) As Collection
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Adds all elements from an array or source Collection to the current Collection.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Adds all elements from an array or source Collection to the current Collection.
methods.inlinecomment: ' Adds all elements from an array or source Collection to the current Collection.
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM<br />The following code creates a collection of scalars containing &quot;One&quot; and 2. It sets suppressErrors on the second collection, then adds the first collection to the second. This adds any strings to the second collection (i.e. &quot;One&quot;), while suppressing errors from any non-String entries (i.e. 2). The second collection contains one element, the string &quot;One&quot;.<br />%END REM<br />Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;SCALAR&quot;, Nothing, False, False)<br />Dim coll2 as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)<br />Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)<br />Call coll.add(2)<br />coll2.suppressErrors = True<br />Call coll2.addAll(coll)

methods.label: contains
methods.comment: Checks whether the Collection contains a specific value. Requires a valid Comparator to compare each element.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Although no explicit comparator is passed into this Collection, an instance of the default Comparator class is used. This works for scalars, by comparing the datatype (treating all numerics as the same datatype) and then CStr-ing the value.
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;SCALAR&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(2)
Print coll.contains(1)   &apos; Prints False
Print coll.contains(2)   &apos; Prints True
methods.signature: Public Function contains(checkValue As Variant) As Boolean
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Checks whether the Collection contains a specific value. Requires a valid Comparator to compare each element.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>

This works for scalars, by comparing the datatype (treating all numerics as the same datatype) and then CStr-ing the value.<br />%END REM<br />Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;SCALAR&quot;, Nothing, False, False)<br />Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)<br />Call coll.add(2)<br />Print coll.contains(1)   &apos; Prints False<br />Print coll.contains(2)   &apos; Prints True

methods.label: filter
methods.comment: Filters a collection using a CollectionFilter and returns a new &quot;filtered&quot; collection
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code shows how to create a filter for even numbers and use it. The code is very basic with no error handling.
%END REM
Class EvenFilterer as CollectionFilter
    Function filter(source as Variant) as Boolean
        If (source Mod 2 = 0) Then Return True
    End Function
End Class
Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim coll2 as Collection
Dim filterer as New EvenFilterer()
&apos; Populating collection omitted
Set coll2 = coll1.filter(filterer)
methods.signature: Public Function filter(filterObj As CollectionFilter) As Collection
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Filters a collection using a CollectionFilter and returns a new &quot;filtered&quot; collection</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>

methods.inlinecomment: ' Filters a collection using a CollectionFilter and returns a new &quot;filtered&quot; collection
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM<br />The following code shows how to create a filter for even numbers and use it. The code is very basic with no error handling.<br />%END REM<br />Class EvenFilterer as CollectionFilter<br />    Function filter(source as Variant) as Boolean<br />        If (source Mod 2 = 0) Then Return True<br />    End Function<br />End Class<br />Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)<br />Dim coll2 as Collection<br />Dim filterer as New EvenFilterer()<br />&apos; Populating collection omitted<br />Set coll2 = coll1.filter(filterer)

methods.label: getAndRemoveFirstRaw
methods.comment:
Returns the FIRST element in the collection and removes it from the collection.
If the collection is empty it just exits the function
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code builds a FIFO queue, printing the entries from the collection
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)
Print CStr(coll.getAndRemoveFirstRaw())    &apos;Prints One
Print CStr(coll.getAndRemoveFirstRaw())    &apos;Prints Two
Print coll.hasContent    &apos;Prints False
methods.signature: Public Function getAndRemoveFirstRaw() As Variant
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Returns the FIRST element in the collection and removes it from the collection.<br />If the collection is empty it just exits the function</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Returns the FIRST element in the collection and removes it from the collection.<br />If the collection is empty it just exits the function
methods.inlinecomment:

If the collection is empty it just exits the function

methods.label: getAndRemoveLastRaw
methods.comment:
Returns the LAST element in the collection and removes it from the collection.
If the collection is empty it just exits the function
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code builds a LIFO stack, printing the entries from the collection
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)
Print CStr(coll.getAndRemoveLastRaw())    &apos;Prints Two
Print CStr(coll.getAndRemoveLastRaw())    &apos;Prints One
Print coll.hasContent    &apos;Prints False
methods.signature: Public Function getAndRemoveLastRaw() As Variant

methods.label: getIndex
methods.comment: Checks whether the Collection contains a specific value.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code creates a Collection of strings. This will print &quot;Contains One&quot; and &quot;Does not contain Two&quot;.
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
If (Not IsNull(coll.getIndex(&quot;One&quot;)) Then Print &quot;Contains One&quot;
If (IsNull(coll.getIndex(&quot;Two&quot;)) Then Print &quot;Does not contain Two&quot;
methods.signature: Public Function getIndex(checkValue As Variant) As Variant

methods.label: getNthElementRaw
methods.comment: Gets the nth elment as a raew variant, starting at index 0
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code gets the element at index 1. It then checks an entry at index 2, which returns that it is empty
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)
Print CStr(coll.getNthElementRaw(1))    &apos; Prints &quot;Two&quot;
Print IsEmpty(coll.getNthElementRaw(5))     &apos; Prints True
methods.signature: Public Function getNthElementRaw(index As Long) As Variant
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Gets the nth elment as a raew variant, starting at index 0</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>

It then checks an entry at index 2, which returns that it is empty<br />%END REM<br />Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)<br />Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)<br />Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)<br />Print CStr(coll.getNthElementRaw(1))    &apos; Prints &quot;Two&quot;<br />Print IsEmpty(coll.getNthElementRaw(5))     &apos; Prints True

methods.label: insertAt
methods.comment: Inserts an element in the collection at an index, starting at index 0. Not allowed for sorted collections
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is abbreviated code from Collection.getIndex. It compares each element against the value being checked, and if it matches, returns the current index.
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim testSuite as New TestSuite(&quot;Validate collections&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)
Call coll.insertAt(&quot;Three&quot;, 1)
Call testSuite.describe(&quot;Check 3 elements&quot;).assertEqualsLong(3, coll.elementCount)
Call testSuite.describe(&quot;Check second element is Three&quot;).assertEqualsString(&quot;Three&quot;, CStr(coll.getNthElementRaw(1), True)
Call testSuite.describe(&quot;Check third element is Two&quot;).assertEqualsString(&quot;Two&quot;, CStr(coll.getNthElementRaw(2), True)
Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, True)    &apos; Sorted
Call coll1.addAll(coll)
Call testSuite.describe(&quot;Test adding to sorted collection&quot;)
Try
    Call coll.insertAt(&quot;Three&quot;, 1)
    Call testSuite.addResult(False, &quot;Successfully inserted into sorted collection, this should have errored&quot;)
Catch
    Call testSuite.addResult(True, &quot;&quot;)
End Try
methods.signature: Public Function insertAt(source As Variant, index As Long) As Boolean
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Inserts an element in the collection at an index, starting at index 0. Not allowed for sorted collections</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>

It compares each element against the value being checked, and if it matches, returns the current index.<br />%END REM<br />Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)<br />Dim testSuite as New TestSuite(&quot;Validate collections&quot;)<br />Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)<br />Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)<br />Call coll.insertAt(&quot;Three&quot;, 1)<br />Call testSuite.describe(&quot;Check 3 elements&quot;).assertEqualsLong(3, coll.elementCount)<br />Call testSuite.describe(&quot;Check second element is Three&quot;).assertEqualsString(&quot;Three&quot;, CStr(coll.getNthElementRaw(1), True)<br />Call testSuite.describe(&quot;Check third element is Two&quot;).assertEqualsString(&quot;Two&quot;, CStr(coll.getNthElementRaw(2), True)<br />Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, True)    &apos; Sorted<br />Call coll1.addAll(coll)<br />Call testSuite.describe(&quot;Test adding to sorted collection&quot;)<br />Try<br />    Call coll.insertAt(&quot;Three&quot;, 1)<br />    Call testSuite.addResult(False, &quot;Successfully inserted into sorted collection, this should have errored&quot;)<br />Catch<br />    Call testSuite.addResult(True, &quot;&quot;)<br />End Try

methods.label: join
methods.comment: Joins a collection of scalar values into a single string response separated by a passed delimiter
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(INTEGER, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(1)
Call coll.add(2)
Print coll.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos; Prints &quot;1,2&quot;
Set coll = new Collection(PERSON, Nothing, False, False)    &apos; Assumes a Person class available
Dim p1 as New Person
Dim p2 as New Person
Call coll.add(p1)
Call coll.add(p2)
Print coll.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos; Prints &quot;NOT STRINGABLE,NOT STRINGABLE&quot;
methods.signature: Public Function join(delim As String) As String

methods.label: remove
methods.comment: Removes an element (or elements, if not unique) from the Collection. Returns the number of elements removed.
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(1)
Call coll.add(2)
Call coll.add(2)
Call coll.add(6)
Call coll.add(2)
Print coll.remove(2, False)   &apos;Prints 1
Print coll.remove(2, True)    &apos; Prints 2

methods.label: replace
methods.comment:
Replaces an element with another and returns the number of replacements made.
If the Collection is unsorted, replacements are made at the same positions.
If the Collection is sorted, the old elements are removed and new ones inserted at the appropriate sorted location.
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(1)
Call coll.add(2)
Call coll.add(6)
Call coll.add(1)
Call coll.replace(1, 3, True)
Print coll.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos;Prints 3,2,6,3
Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, True)
Call coll1.add(1)
Call coll1.add(2)
Call coll1.add(6)
Call coll1.add(1)
Call coll1.replace(1, 3, True)
Print coll1.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos;Prints 2,3,3,6
methods.argumentsuffix: (oldValue As Variant, newValue As Variant, allMatches As Boolean)
methods.signature: Public Function replace(oldValue As Variant, newValue As Variant, allMatches As Boolean) As Long
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Replaces an element with another and returns the number of replacements made.<br />If the Collection is unsorted, replacements are made at the same positions.<br />If the Collection is sorted, the old elements are removed and new ones inserted at the appropriate sorted location.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Replaces an element with another and returns the number of replacements made.<br />If the Collection is unsorted, replacements are made at the same positions.<br />If the Collection is sorted, the old elements are removed and new ones inserted at the appropriate sorted location.
methods.inlinecomment:
' Replaces an element with another and returns the number of replacements made.
If the Collection is unsorted, replacements are made at the same positions.
If the Collection is sorted, the old elements are removed and new ones inserted at the appropriate sorted location.
methods.codesamplehtml: Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)<br />Call coll.add(1)<br />Call coll.add(2)<br />Call coll.add(6)<br />Call coll.add(1)<br />Call coll.replace(1, 3, True)<br />Print coll.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos;Prints 3,2,6,3<br />Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, True)<br />Call coll1.add(1)<br />Call coll1.add(2)<br />Call coll1.add(6)<br />Call coll1.add(1)<br />Call coll1.replace(1, 3, True)<br />Print coll1.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos;Prints 2,3,3,6

methods.label: toJson
methods.comment:
Converts the Collection to a JsonObject that&apos;s an array.
If the array values are objects, the code will try to call a toJson method on the object, otherwise skip them.
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim jsonObj as JsonObject
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)
Set jsonObj = coll.toJson()
Print jsonObj.toString(False)    &apos;Prints [&quot;One&quot;,&quot;Two&quot;]

methods.label: suppressErrors
methods.comment:
Suppress errors on adding elements. Errors wll still be thrown if the Collection is locked
or attempting to insert an entry into a sorted Collection.
Instead of throwing an error, e.g. for wrong content type, the method will just return false
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code will print &quot;Error adding&quot; for the first Try/Catch. But for the second, the error will be suppressed and the call to .add() will return False
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim success as Boolean
Try
    success = coll.add(2)
    Print success    &apos; Code will not get to this line
Catch
    Print &quot;Error adding&quot;   &apos; This will be printed
End Try
coll.suppressErrors = True
Try
    success = coll.add(2)
    Print success    &apos; Code will print False
Catch
    Print &quot;Error adding&quot;   &apos; This will NOT be printed
End Try
methods.signature: Public Property Get suppressErrors As Boolean
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Suppress errors on adding elements. Errors wll still be thrown if the Collection is locked<br />or attempting to insert an entry into a sorted Collection.<br />Instead of throwing an error, e.g. for wrong content type, the method will just return false</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Suppress errors on adding elements. Errors wll still be thrown if the Collection is locked<br />or attempting to insert an entry into a sorted Collection.<br />Instead of throwing an error, e.g. for wrong content type, the method will just return false

Instead of throwing an error, e.g. for wrong content type, the method will just return false

methods.label: suppressErrors
methods.comment:
Suppress errors on adding elements. Errors wll still be thrown if the Collection is locked
or attempting to insert an entry into a sorted Collection.
Instead of throwing an error, e.g. for wrong content type, the method will just return false
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code will print &quot;Error adding&quot; for the first Try/Catch. But for the second, the error will be suppressed and the call to .add() will return False
%END REM
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim success as Boolean
Try
    success = coll.add(2)
    Print success    &apos; Code will not get to this line
Catch
    Print &quot;Error adding&quot;   &apos; This will be printed
End Try
coll.suppressErrors = True
Try
    success = coll.add(2)
    Print success    &apos; Code will print False
Catch
    Print &quot;Error adding&quot;   &apos; This will NOT be printed
End Try

methods.label: clear
methods.comment: Removes all values from the Collection and resets whether the collection is reversed.
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Print coll.elementCount    &apos; Prints 1
Call coll.clear()
Print coll.elementCount    &apos; Prints 0

methods.label: fromJson
methods.comment: Loads the scalar values array from the JsonObject into the Collection. Can only be used for a JsonObject that contains a single array of scalars.
methods.codesample:
Dim jsonObj as New JsonObject
Call jsonObj.appendToJsonArray(1)
Call jsonObj.appendToJsonArray(2)
Call jsonObj.appendToJsonArray(3)
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, True, True)
Call coll.fromJson(jsonObj)

methods.label: lock
methods.comment:
Locks the collection, so any add, remove, replace or reverse functions trigger errors. 
		Useful when passing a collection to other functions.
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Call coll.lock()
Call coll.add(&quot;Two&quot;)   &apos; Throws error

methods.label: reverse
methods.comment: Reverses a collection
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.add(&quot;A&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;B&quot;)
Call coll.reverse()
Call coll.add(&quot;C&quot;)
Print coll.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos; Prints B,A,C
Set coll = new Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, True)
Call coll.add(&quot;A&quot;)
Call coll.add(&quot;B&quot;)
Call coll.reverse()
Call coll.add(&quot;C&quot;)
Print coll.join(&quot;,&quot;)   Prints C,B,A

methods.label: transform
methods.comment: Transforms members of this Collection using a CollectionTransformer and adds them to the new Collection passed
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code shows how to create a transformer to square values. The code is very basic with no error handling.
%END REM
Class SquareTransformer as CollectionTransformer
    Function transform(source as Variant) as Variant
        transform = source * source
    End Function
End Class
Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim coll2 as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Dim transformer as New SquareTransformer()
Call coll1.add(2)
Call coll1.add(3)
Call coll1.add(4)
Call coll1.transform(transformer, coll2)
Print coll2.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos; Prints 4,9,16
methods.signature: Public Sub transform(transformer As CollectionTransformer, newColl As Collection)
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Transforms members of this Collection using a CollectionTransformer and adds them to the new Collection passed</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>

methods.inlinecomment: ' Transforms members of this Collection using a CollectionTransformer and adds them to the new Collection passed
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM<br />The following code shows how to create a transformer to square values. The code is very basic with no error handling.<br />%END REM<br />Class SquareTransformer as CollectionTransformer<br />    Function transform(source as Variant) as Variant<br />        transform = source * source<br />    End Function<br />End Class<br />Dim coll1 as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)<br />Dim coll2 as New Collection(&quot;INTEGER&quot;, Nothing, False, False)<br />Dim transformer as New SquareTransformer()<br />Call coll1.add(2)<br />Call coll1.add(3)<br />Call coll1.add(4)<br />Call coll1.transform(transformer, coll2)<br />Print coll2.join(&quot;,&quot;)    &apos; Prints 4,9,16

methods.label: unlock
methods.comment: Unlocks the Collection, so add, remove, replace or reverse functions can be used again
methods.codesample:
Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)
Call coll.lock()
Try
    Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)
Catch
    &apos; Code will enter this catch block
End Try
Call coll.unlock()
Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)   &apos; This will be successful
methods.signature: Public Sub unlock()
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Unlocks the Collection, so add, remove, replace or reverse functions can be used again</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Unlocks the Collection, so add, remove, replace or reverse functions can be used again
methods.inlinecomment: ' Unlocks the Collection, so add, remove, replace or reverse functions can be used again
methods.codesamplehtml: Dim coll as New Collection(&quot;STRING&quot;, Nothing, False, False)<br />Call coll.lock()<br />Try<br />    Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)<br />Catch<br />    &apos; Code will enter this catch block<br />End Try<br />Call coll.unlock()<br />Call coll.add(&quot;One&quot;)   &apos; This will be successful
